doc:
John Eldredge (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Eldredge_(actor) 0 John Eldredge (August 30, 1904 – September 23, 1961) was an American actor from San Francisco. He was the younger brother of character actor George Eldredge (1898–1977).Born August 30, 1904, John Eldredge was the son of a clergyman who made a speciality of dramatics at university. When he confessed to his father that he wanted to be an actor, his father grinned and said: "That's all right son so long as you are a good one." He began his theatrical career in repertory and then in comic opera and later played small parts in New York City till he made a hit on Broadway and it was a role opposite Lillian Gish that won him a Warners film contract.Eldredge's Broadway credits include Three-Cornered Moon (1932), The Good Fairy (1932), Katerina (1928), The Cherry Orchard (1928), and The Would-be Gentleman (1928).In 1954–1955, Aldredge played Harry Archer, father of the title character, in the CBS Television situation comedy Meet Corliss Archer.He died September 23, 1961 of a heart attack at Laguna Beach, California, United States. John_Eldredge ( August_30_,_1904 – September_23_,_1961 ) was an_American_actor from San_Francisco . He was the_younger_brother of character_actor_George_Eldredge_(_1898 – 1977_) . Born August_30_,_1904 , John_Eldredge was the_son of a_clergyman who made a_speciality of dramatics at university . When he confessed to his_father that he wanted_to_be an_actor , his_father grinned and said : " That 's all right_son so_long as you are a_good_one . " He began his_theatrical_career in repertory and then in comic_opera and later_played small_parts in New_York_City till he made a hit on Broadway and it was a_role opposite_Lillian_Gish that won him a_Warners_film_contract.Eldredge 's_Broadway_credits include Three-Cornered_Moon_(_1932_) , The_Good_Fairy_(_1932_) , Katerina_(_1928_) , The_Cherry_Orchard_(_1928_) , and The_Would-be_Gentleman_(_1928_) . In 1954 – 1955 , Aldredge played Harry_Archer , father of the_title_character , in the_CBS_Television_situation_comedy_Meet_Corliss_Archer.He died September_23_,_1961 of a_heart_attack at Laguna_Beach , California , United_States .
